Permit help guide

LA City vs LA County: Who Should You Pull Permits With?

Confirm jurisdiction first so your permit goes to the right office and avoids avoidable delays.

Need a decision-ready PDF for a specific address? Get the Permit Due Diligence Dossier (Fast-Track $499).

One of the most common questions we hear in Los Angeles is: “Do I pull this permit with LADBS or LA County?” Getting this wrong can cost weeks of delay.

Quick Jurisdiction Check

Here’s the simple way to figure it out:

  1. Look up the address on the City’s or County’s online tools.
  2. Use LA County’s EPIC-LA Permit Helper or Service Locator to see if the property falls under County Building & Safety or a contract city.
  3. If the property is in the City of Los Angeles, building permits generally go through LADBS.

Typical Split Between LADBS & LA County

  • LADBS (City of LA): Central LA, large parts of the Valley, Hollywood, DTLA, many hillside areas.
  • LA County Building & Safety: Unincorporated pockets, some SGV areas, and contract cities where the County handles plan review and inspections.

Why Jurisdiction Matters

Each agency has its own:

  • Online portals and forms.
  • Plan review timelines.
  • Fee schedules and calculation tools.
  • Inspection scheduling systems.

Apply to the wrong place and you may have to cancel and start over.

How PermitPulse Can Help

Our team lives in the LA permit world every day. We:

  • Use live permit data to see how similar projects are being processed.
  • Help contractors focus efforts on the right office and the right projects.
  • Run outreach campaigns to owners and GCs who already pulled permits in your trade and ZIP codes.
